pages.name: welcome
pages.text:
Welcome to Townforge, a blockchain based Norse themed emergent city simulator, with embedded RPG elements.

Press >> below for an overview and quick start guide to key game mechanics, or Done to play the game right now.
You can always review any tutorial screen later from the options screen.

pages.name: blockchain
pages.text: Townforge runs on a heavily modified fork of the cryptocurrency Monero. This means Townforge is decentralized, and the game is distributed among a network of peers, and all game actions are appended to the game blockchain based on consensus rules upon block discovery. The game aims to find new blocks every 30 seconds, meaning the game state progresses - on average - every 30 seconds.

pages.name: crypto
pages.text: Townforge implements its own cryptocurrency, Townforge Gold (TFG). TFG is used as main means for in-game transactions, and it can be obtained by mining blocks to the blockchain, purchasing from other players or miners, or via in-game actions such as town treasury payouts.

pages.name: wallet
pages.text: In order to play, you need to create a wallet or load an existing one. This wallet is essentially your means to accessing your in-game account. Please note that due to the decentralized nature of Townforge, if you lose your wallet access, nobody can recover it for you - due to this it is essential to keep the walle secure and store its 16 word recovery mnemonic seed, preferably at a secure physical location.

pages.name: concepts
pages.text:
It is important to understand that playing Townforge essentially consists of: the daemon, the Townforge network, and the game client. 

1) The daemon is your connection to the Townforge network - it will broadcast your commands, and receive current game state. 
2) The network is governed by consensus rules, that keep track that new appended blocks to the blockchains contain commands that adhere to Townforge rules. 
3) Finally, the default game client uses the open source Urho3D engine - but as an open source project, you could use any non-official client or even create your very own!

pages.name: gameplay1
pages.text: The persistent world of Townforge is loosely based on Norse lore, but there is no single correct way to play. You can become a city building mogul, a fervent role player, an architect, an in-game market manipulating bull, a share driven research-enterprise, and much more. The game is designed with emergence both mechanistically and aesthetically, with players driving the development of the Townforge world.

pages.name: gameplay2
pages.text: In the default game client, the main UI panel is located on the top-right corner, with ESC opening up the options. Movement happens with standard WASD-style movement, with holding right mouse button to drag camera direction. The arrow keys can be alternatively used for moving the camera. Shift will accelerate the speed of movement and rotation. Left mouse button is used for selecting terrain and blocks and interacting with the UI. Finally, buttons Q, E, Z, and C are advanced buttons in building voxels, and X is used for material selection.

pages.name: gameplay3
pages.text: The main game panel opens from top-right corner of the game screen contains all the accessible actions. Depending your current status (such as selected terrain), various options are greyed out or available - for example, purchasing land is available when player has a rectangular selection activated on the game terrain.

pages.name: time
pages.text: All game actions are stored in blocks in the blockchain. These blocks that contain the game transactions are automatically set so that on average every 30 seconds a new block is appended to the blockchain. Hence, the game progresses in short bumps. In addition to individual game blocks advancing the game state, every 720th block is a special game tick, during which heavier game logic is resolved and heavier game logic is processed.
